alert.note: Alert for Gove; Graham (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 17 at 2:48PM CDT until March 18 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Graham and Gove Counties. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 4 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A band of heavy snow and near blizzard conditions are expected to develop over portions of central Kansas tonight. The location of this band is somewhat uncertain, and it is possible that band of snow more significantly impacts Graham and Gove Counties that currently anticipated.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. If you can delay travel, do so as conditions could become dangerous. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
